placesVisited: Antananarivo, Antsirabe, Betafo farming village, Lake Tritriva, Sahambavy rural highlands, Ambositra, Malagasy cultural insight, Train ride to Manakara, Boat tour of Canal des Pangalanes, Ranomafana National Park, Nocturnal nature walk, Ambalavao, Tsaranoro Valley, Fianarantsoa wine tasting tour, Andringtra National Park, Isalo National Park, Two full days at Anakao beach
generalInfo:
There's no better way to find out more about Madagascar other than this private 16 day tour. You'll experience everything from the exotic wildlife and golden sand beaches of Anakao to the semi-arid highlands of the south and the dramatic canyons of Isalo National Park.

Exploring in the company of a personal guide and driver allows you to learn as you travel as well as opening up an array of answers to any questions you might have along the way.

Meeting Malagasy communities, on their level, is another important part of making the most of Madagascar with opportunities to understand the country's conservation initiatives adding to a truly unique experience.

Rounding off this 16 day tailor made tour with two full days at the beach is a brilliant way to unwind and remember all of your adventures. However, this is your holiday so please feel free to suggest a pace and itinerary that you think would suit you best.

dayInfo.description: Antananarivo ‘’Manao ahoana’’ & ‘’Salama’’ Welcome to tropical paradise. You will be welcomed & greeted by your guide or our representative on arrival at Antananarivo Ivato International Airport. You will travel to your hotel. Travel time approximately 40-50 minutes depend on the road traffic. Location: - Antananarivo; Hotel: Belvedere; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Antananarivo - Antsirabe (journey time 3-4 hours): After early breakfast you will travel to Antsirabe, one of the most beautiful scenic routes in the central highlands. Antsirabe is the third largest city in Madagascar situated in the high altitude (about 1 500 m). The cool temperatures are in the high altitude the reason why the Norwegian Missionaries chose this city in 1872. Antsirabe is the home of one of the award winning best beers in Madagascar THB (Three Horses Beer). Its name means “where there is salt” honouring the large number of hot springs the town has, a fact that has given the city the nickname of “Malagasy Vichy”. The thermal baths had been long appreciated for their curative effects by the local population when French colonists decided to locate a thermal bath here in the 19th century. In the afternoon you will take pousse-pousse rickshaw tour of Antsirabe to discover this interesting city mixed with architectural styles of the colonial and evangelical past. In the European district French cottage-style houses are built next to Scandinavian villas with English style gardens. The tree-lined avenues always give some freshness whenever the sun is too bright. Location: - Antsirabe; Hotel: Soa Guest House; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Antsirabe: In the morning you will visit Betafo farming village. Betafo was once the capital of one of four ancient kingdoms of the Betsileo people. These people developed terraced rice fields and an irrigation system to water them in the 17th century. They left their mark in the terraced hillsides that frame the areas red brick villages today. You will get better understanding of the village life in the highlands as they depend on agriculture. On your way back you will visit emerald green Lake Tritriva, one of the two volcanic lakes with legendary tales. The water level drop in the rainy season and rise in the dry season debris from the lake can found down in a valley below, supporting a theory of existing underground channels. Lake Tritriva is situated near the village of Betafo. It’s typical highland village with red houses with red tiled roofs. Afternoon at leisure or you can visit the local market or Zebu Horn workshop. Location: - Antsirabe; Hotel: Soa Guest House; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Antsirabe - Sahambavy (journey time 4-5 hours): In the morning you will travel to Sahambavy. It is a scenic route with many viewpoints to enjoy the breathtaking views. As you travel through the rural highlands, you will have breathtaking views of everyday activities of locals. Depending on the time of the year, visitors can witness the rice harvest, natural silk weaving and jewel manufacturing. From May to September ovens for clay- brick baking. With some luck resting locals might invite you to sit with them. Take advantage of their hospitality to learn a lot about Malagasy traditional life. You will stop for lunch in Ambositra. Ambositra is an art and crafty town located in a picturesque valley dotted with rice fields. You will have short tour of the town. This is Madagascar wood carving centre with red brick Betsileo houses. After lunch you will continue your journey towards Sahambavy. Location: - Sahambavy; Hotel: Lac Hotel; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Sahambavy - Manakara: After breakfast you will walk to the Sahambavy Train station just 2 minutes from the hotel. At around 08:00 am you will experience the scenic train journey to Manakara in the East Coast (approximate duration 10-14 hours) by Fianarantsoa Cote Est (FCE) Train. This spectacular route teeters along viaducts, crosses more than 60 bridges, cuts through steep-sided jungle valleys and rockets down the world's third-steepest railway incline. The railway lines were constructed during French Colonial times to transport raw materials for export to France. Upon arrival you will be transferred to your hotel. Location: - Manakara Hotel: Hotel Parthenay Club Board: Breakfast; Packed Lunch & Dinner

Manakara - Ranomafana: After breakfast you take a pirogue boat tour of Canal des Pangalanes for 2 hours. You will see the fisherman retuning after their catch in the sea, after you will continue your journey through the canal to see herbal medical plantation. You will finish with the BBQ Seafood lunch on beach and local musician to entertain. After lunch you will continue your journey towards Ranomafana. (Travel time approximately 4 hours). In the evening you will have an hour night walk along the park boarder with a guide to spot nocturnal wildlife. Location: - Ranomafana; Hotel: Centrest Sejour Hotel ; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Ranomafana: After breakfast you will explore this wonderful rainforest with your specialist park guide. Ranomafana National Park is a conservation success story in terms of many ways. Today Ranomafana plays crucial role in education and scientific research with help of Centre Valbio Research Centre. Ranomafana National Park success is because of one woman’s vision and dedication to preserve the nature and wildlife. Dr. Patricia Wright is considered to be one of the world’s foremost experts on lemurs, Wright is best known for her 26-year study of social and family interactions of wild lemurs in Ranomafana National Park, Madagascar. Ranomafana is a rainforest and spreads over 41,601 hectares in the high altitudes. There are many different forest types, from lowland rainforest to cloud forest and high plateau forest. It was classified World Natural Heritage site of the Atsinanana in 2007. It shelters a big wealth in endemic biodiversity with challenges. You can see the rare species and seriously threatened lemurs. The park is also the genetic reservoir of some rare and endemic plant species. There are many rivers and streams passes through the forest. There are several animal species have been recorded, 12 species of lemurs, including golden bamboo lemur, greater bamboo lemur, Milne-Edward’s shifaka, red bellied lemur etc, 115 species of birds. About thirty among them exist exclusively in the primary forest of the park. As well 90 species of butterflies, 98 species of amphibian and 62 species of reptiles; chameleons, lizards and fish. Your specialist park guide will explain to you the circuits available before based on your fitness, expectation and the circuits. The shortest trekking Circuit Varibolomena takes about (2-3 hrs). This soft circuit is about 3 kilometres. In some of the evening there will be lectures about conservation in the Valbio Centre. Also you can visit the centre during the opening hours. Location: - Ranomafana; Hotel: Centrest Sejour Hotel ;Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Ranomafana - Ambalavao - Tsaranoro Valley: After breakfast you will travel to Andringitra. En-route, you will visit the fascinating little town of Ambalavao in the central highlands south of Fianarantsoa. The town is known for its paper-making, silk making and wines. The striking feature of this town is the architecture. The old town houses with wooden balconies. From the centre of the market you can get a good view of the town houses and the church. Ambalavao is famous for Antaimoro paper-making and you can visit the paper factory. Also you can interact with workers and try your own decoration with inlayed flowers, leaves and petals are made out of it. From simple decorative paper, it is turned into postcards, wall hangings, gift bags, lampshades and many more items. This town is the centre for Zebu (Malagasy horned cattle) trading for all the surrounding countryside. Many tribes bring their herds of cattle here to the weekly Zebu market (every Wednesday). You will visit a vineyard; this region is the wine capital of Madagascar. It produces some excellent red and white wines in the terraced vineyards. You will visit a small, peaceful village in the vicinity of vineyards, where wine can be bought. Here you will have an opportunity to enjoy the tastes of Madagascar wines. You can also buy some to take home as souvenirs. After wards you travel towards Andringtra National Park Tsaranoro Valley. Location: - Tsaranoro Valley; Hotel: Tsara Camp; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Tsaranoro Valley: After breakfast you will be trekking towards sacred Forest of Tsaranoro and the area is full of ring tail lemurs. Starting from the camp; you are entering into lush vegetation where different species of endemic tree abounds, and which are infected by the "Ficus Strangler” (tall fig trees). You can also observe termite nests. After crossing a small stream, we take the path up to the right. It is small round through the caves and the traces of past habitation of the forest. We do not miss to climb on top of a big block that will offer you a view overhanging vegetation. This forest is now the habitat Ring tail lemurs. You may able to be see them jump from tree to tree ... We go back on the main road through the forest where is the little low wall shape of circles. The healer used to do sacrifice on this circle to improve their "charms" and potions ...You will be temporarily out of vegetation and you have a remarkable view. Now we are near the Tsaranoro’s cliff. The path takes you several directions. You go down a few minutes and you arrive in the grasslands of the lower part of the forest. Grazing areas, you can still make out heaps of stones constituting the ruins of ancient parks zebu. Throughout this trip, many tombs are visible, often in their proximity, square shaped stones stacks culminating on the blocks. These are "aloalo" ancient ceremonial places of death. This forest is still the cemetery of the inhabitants of the valley. We continue our way up to a small stream from which we move promptly to camp. After picnic lunch you will continue and visit to the village of Sahanambo to discover the daily life of inhabitants. We take the path that joins the track and the village of Andonaka. You pass first through the “Tsaranoro’s School ". On weekdays, you can visit the students and two teachers. In the village you will come across women pounding rice in traditional method. You will see traditional architecture of Bara & Betsileo tribes with houses without floors. Land built, some often colored balconies are signs of wealth. You will walk pass the villages, rice fields, waterfalls to reach Sahanambo River. Afterwards you will take the path towards the hotel. Location: - Tsaranoro Valley; Hotel: Tsara camp; Board: Breakfast, Picnic Lunch & Dinner

Tsaranoro Valley - Isalo: After breakfast you will travel to Isalo in the south. The South of Madagascar is known for its spiny forests, cactus trees with colourful tribes. Location: Ranohira; Hotel: Isalo Ranch; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Isalo National Park: Isalo National Park is the Grand Canyon of Madagascar. Kingdom of Queen of the Isalo, cradle of a particular wild nature and an exceptional landscape, the lovers of the big escapes will be seduced by this park. It appeal is the remarkable landscape of the Jurassic Era eroded ruiniform sandstone, canyons and rare plants as well as the wildlife. Trekking Circuit of the natural swimming pool or Canyons (3 kms) 3-4 hours trekking of Isalo, there are several circuits and you can talk to the guide for the best option that suits your expectation & fitness. Most hiking circuits include the natural swimming pool. It’s really worth a dip in the natural swimming pool, its oasis. These are 77 species of birds live in Isalo among which the Benson rock-thrush Pseudocossyphus bensoni, an endemic species of Madagascar that is well protected. You can also find 14 species of nocturnal lemurs, as well as ring-tailed, Verreaux’s Shifakas and red-fronted brown lemurs. In the late afternoon, you visit the Window of Isalo to see the sunset for a spectacular view. Location: Ranohira; Hotel: Isalo Ranch; Board: Breakfast, Picnic Lunch & Dinner

Isalo National Park - Tulear (journey time 4-5 hours): After breakfast you will travel to Tulear. Rest of the journey you will be able to see changing landscape of semi-arid South. You can stop and admire many baobab trees dotted along the way. Once in Tulear, you will have time to explore the local market which is considered as one of the main attractions of the city. You will experience a very typical southern Malagasy market where you can spot and buy the lambas (pareos). Fondly known by locals as the ‘City of the Sun’, this coastal city is most commonly used as a base for exploring the Great Reef. Toliara is located on a broad coastal plain, surrounded by towering dunes and gorgeous mangroves. It is home to some excellent restaurants where you can sample the fabulously fresh and flavourful local cuisine. The city is characterised by a bohemian, tropical ambience, colonial-style buildings, and dusty lanes teeming with brightly coloured rickshaws called ‘pousse-pousse’. Location: - Tulear; Hotel: Moringa; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Anakao: After breakfast, you will travel to Anakao for 2 days of full relaxation and beautiful beaches. Activities can be arranged with the hotel. The charming fishing village of Anakao is idyllically set on the scenic southwestern coast of Madagascar. The shoreline boasts a string of crescent-shaped white-sand beaches lapped by crystalline turquoise waters. This popular holiday destination is the quintessential laid-back Malagasy beachside paradise. Visitors can look forward to a host of activities such as: world-class surfing five kilometres offshore; early morning strolls past the fishermen fixing their nets and prepping their boats for the day; and traditional fishing pirogue adventures to the offshore island of Nosy Ve, home to a variety of tropical birds and unspoilt beaches. Other great activities include: a boat trip through the mangroves to the south; excellent snorkelling through multi-coloured coral reefs teeming with abundant marine life including surgeonfish, angelfish, and butterfly fish; and catching a glimpse of Madagascar’s endemic ring-tailed lemurs, chameleons, tortoises and flamingos at the nearby Tsimanampetsotsa National Park. Location: - Anakao; Hotel: Safari Vezo; Board: Breakfast & Dinner.
Anakao: Full day at leisure. Location: - Anakao; Hotel: Safari Vezo; Board: Breakfast & Dinner.

Anakao - Antananarivo: After breakfast you will travel to Tulear to fly to Antananarivo. You will take a flight to capital Tana. Flight time approximately an hour. Antananarivo ‘City of Thousand Warriors ‘is the capital situated above 1500 metres above sea level with pleasant cool climate. It is known as Tana by locals with rich cultural and historical sites of Merina people. Once thriving Imerina Kingdom ruled Madgascar until the French Colonisation. After lunch you will explore the city in upper town (“La Haute ville”), where Palaces (Queen's palace, ancient Prime Minister Rainilaiarivony palace, ancient Justice Palace), cathedrals and the residential area of (mostly) ancient noblemen families are located. From here, visitors enjoy a nice perspective of the city below far away from the hassle of downtown. You can also buy souvenirs here. In the evening witness the best sun set with a Sundowner Drinks at Lakonga, Its best place to say cheers to great trip around Madagascar with glass of wine or beer with a beautiful view of Antananarivo. And look back at the great times you had in Madagascar. Location: - Antananarivo; Hotel: Pavillon Lemyrne; Board: Breakfast & Dinner
Antananarivo - Fly Back Home: Depend on your flight time you will travel to Airport to fly back home.
